text: Jaysh al-Ahrar (Arabic: جَيْشُ الْأَحْرَارِ) is a Sunni Islamist militant group in northwestern Syria that started off as a small sub group within Ahrar al-Sham that were against Operation Euphrates Shield which led to them leaving Ahrar al-Sham. Most of the group's members joined Tahrir al-Sham in January of 2017. The founder of Jaysh al-Ahrar, Abu Jaber Shaykh was appointed as the head of Tahrir al-Sham. Jaysh al-Ahrar left Tahrir al-Sham in September of 2017, and have worked with both Tahrir al-Sham and Ahrar al-Sham, along with some other militant groups. == References == Category:Islamist militant groups
title: Jaysh al-Ahrar
